author: cristina marin

text: 'refused request for butter with  bread !!\nTotally ridiculous'

author: Sam Prouse
text: 'Truffle burrata is with old truffles and no truffle flavor. People love the pistachio pasta. Thought it was disgusting.'

author: erika paoli
text: 'Amazing place‚Ä¶ service and food‚Ä¶. Just the best .\nLove it !!!!!'

author: Grant Williams
text: 'What a great experience lui was a great bartender he guided a excellent dinning experience. And wonderfully crafted cocktails'

author: Gustavo Salles
text: 'VERY good cuisine and at a great price. A jewel!'

author: J. D. Baldwin
text: "COVID took them from 5-stars-plus to a mediocre three stars. Their menu
column5: the food and other factors declined pretty severely. Had two disappointingly mediocre meals at this formerly excellent establishment.\n\nIt's still okay. You won't get a BAD meal or BAD service here. But there are literally a dozen terrific restaurants in Hoboken that kept their standards up
column6: up
column7: up
column8: despite the setbacks of the pandemic and the government's response to it. Find and patronize them."

author: Ella Voloshina
text: 'I celebrated my daughters first birthday by throwing a brunch party at Sorellina. I was thrilled with the entire experience - from planning to the party itself. Nicole
column5: the event coordinator
column6: was incredibly patient and responsive
column7: and assisted with and answered all of my questions (which were considerable). The day of the party
column8: the Sorellina team was incredibly organized and the event ran very smoothly. They even made the outside area available for my guests! The food was excellent and the drinks were fantastic as well - my guests especially loved the aperol spritz‚Äôs. The crowning jewel of all of this was the desert table. I ordered a cake and a variety of goodies and the team at Sorellina helped organize it to be a beautiful dessert table. Even more than being beautiful
column9: everything was absolutely delicious. The cake deserves its own shoutout because it was amazing. I‚Äôm so happy that I chose Sorellina for my baby‚Äôs party!'

author: Fargol Araghi
text: "I had a brunch there which was nice; especially the French toast. It wasn't too sweet!"

author: Pieter Leo
text: 'By far best restaurant in Hoboken
column5: lived here for 4 years and it was our go to for any night in the week
column6: Italian like it supposed to be. Al Dante pasta all home made
column7: flavorful and original creative apps and great wine list. Plus owner and staff are amazing!'

author: Sharon
text: 'The French toast was ok
column5: but the turkey meatball pasta was delicious! The service was a bit slow on Saturday noon
column6: but the waiters are very friendly and helpful. I recommend sitting outside if the weather is nice
column7: inside gets a bit noisy. I would go back!'

author: David Rosensaft
text: 'Attentive service. Creative and inspired dishes. Excellent selection of wines
column5: aperitifs and amaros.  Ceasar  salad had unusual presentation and take on dressing but very tasty.  Homemade olive oil and breads were great.   Overall
column6: a great place.'

author: Ronald White
text: 'This restaurant has AMAZING food. I was so excited to be seated with a physical menu and not one I needed to download. The options are truly chef inspired and a culinary delight. Our server took our appetizer and drink order and within a few minutes returned with our drinks.. However
column5: he then proceeded to tell us that he could not put out appetizer order in without ordering our entrees at the same time. This was a kill moment. I didn\'t know what I would be having at that time. We were not given the option for ordering our entrees after our appetizers. So
column6: we had to end our check. I never had this happen and was more than disappointed that we could NOT order more
column7: as the food was most delicious. I hope that they are able to figure out this glitch
column8: so that they are able to appropriately serve their future guests. I will never understand how hospitality is being controled by a "computer won\'t let me" attitude. After all
column9: what good is having fantastic food

author: Andrew Borsen
text: "Best Italian place in Hoboken. Kyle (our waiter) was incredible
column5: we lost something in the restaurant and he remembered
column6: called and offered to drive it to our home! If that is not service I don't know what is ..... plus Kyle was just an awesome server and person all around. If you're in Hoboken and don't go you are really missing on the best Italian."

author: Gary DeSarno
text: 'Very nice atmosphere here. Appetizers were amazing (bruschetta with burratta and strawberries and calamari with a blueberry sauce. Both were unlike anything I‚Äôve had before
column5: in a good way). Dessert also amazing
column6: 7 layer cookie cake and chocolate donuts. Where we were disappointed was the pasta entrees. We got the Short Rib Farfalle and Rigatoni Bolognese
column7: both were a let down
column8: especially coming off of the fantastic appetizers. Would go again but probably just for a few drinks and appetizers.'

author: J F
text: "I've never felt so ripped off going out to dinner. The portions are so small and so expensive. I thought some of the pictures of the dishes were from people who already ate some of the dishes but they weren't! Ordered the calamari and it looked like someone are half the order. It was barely half a bowl. We also had the braised short rib farfalle. Thumbnail sized rib pieces and a handful of noodles for $25. Italian food is very cheap in general. Don't go here and get ripped off."

author: Sruti Jain
text: 'Amazing food
column5: good service. Would definitely recommend and come back to this place'

author: G. Lee
text: 'It was not the best bolognese pasta with over seasoned sauce. The vibe was good though. I will go again but for sure I won‚Äôt have the same dish.'

author: Frank J
text: "Not worth it. We went there for our wedding anniversary and the experience wasn't that good
column5: wouldn't recommend this place. First the food was not up to the mark with everything a little too much on the salty side
column6: even the calamari which was heavily recommended. The outdoor seating had water dripping from some air conditioner above in the building."

author: Michael Natale
text: 'The quality of the food and drink is good.  The service lacks the attentiveness and organization required for the patron to experience a good flow in his/her dining. Drinks took way too long to arrive from time of order. Food portions felt small for the price tag
column5: especially a few of the pasta dishes.'

author: Frank Jackson
text: "Had dinner here a few weeks back and nothing was particularly good. I did like the carrots. Otherwise
column5: it was blah and food was very salty. You can't replace the flavor of food by just making it more salty. Oh well.."

author: Diana Bergan
text: 'I had originally wanted to have my engagement party here back in 2020 but had to postpone twice due to covid- but the owner Gabi was so kind and flexible and accommodating that I knew we still wanted to do some kind of wedding event here! So I ended up having my bridal shower here yesterday and it was so lovely!! Everything I hoped for and more!! Erica was super helpful at answering my million emails and questions (THANK YOU ERICA!!!) and made adjustments to the menu to accommodate guests that had special dietary restrictions. They were also so flexible about moving us from an outdoor to indoor  set up last minute because it ended up being really hot that day and I had concerns about whether people would be melting. All in all it was perfect
column5: the food was delicious
column6: the service was great and both Gabi and Erica were so wonderful to work with in making my bridal shower a success! Highly recommend if you are planning an event to host it here!'

author: Tim Compernolle
text: 'Great brunch spot'

author: Engie Emrys
text: 'Great restaurant. Loved everything'

author: Harry Lee
text: 'Awesome place
column5: awesome chef
column6: awesome staffs.  Perfect place.'

author: Bailey Mariner
text: 'Any bad review on the food alone- they don‚Äôt have taste buds please don‚Äôt let them deter you. We were soooo pleasantly surprised by everything! We ordered the the charcuterie
column5: scallops
column6: tuna taretare and calamari. Everything was very fresh and super tasty. Our favorite was definitely the scallops! The tuna was spicy and the calamari super light and I never had it with blueberries before! We also had some rose which was nice and refreshing. Definitely coming back and would totally recommend.'

author: Gicell Reyes

text: 'My kids and husband took me here for a late Mother‚Äôs Day dinner gift.  Place is very nice service was great

column8: mostly decorative vegetables that were salty as well.\nWe order plain pasta with sauce for my 2 yr ok granddaughter and had to send it back
column9: wasn‚Äôt cooked at all very hard. The dinner plates we ordered had no flavor and were cold
column10: I can‚Äôt believe they make anything fresh here.\nI would  recognize this place if you just want to sit outside and have drinks
column11: but the food was awful and over priced for the quality..Service was good just wish the was to .'

text: '5 stars because michael was the best.  Loved the olive oil so much and expressed to michael i could not find it anywhere online (literally could not find a trace of it anywhere) as he explained the company does not sell to the public and will not be able to find it for sale.  he kindly asked the chef if i could purchase a bottle directly from the restaurant.  Thank you so much michael!'

text: 'Had such a bad exercise over there. The service was so lame

text: 'Bad service

text: 'They close at 10:00pm and seat the last customers at 8:30pm so we were refused a table for two at 8:45pm.\n\nMeanwhile

author: Max ‚ÄúMaxer‚Äù

author: Sena Senturk
text: "Extremely disappointed! My friend reserved for Friday night
column5: however when we got there they said they had no reservation under her name. She even showed her call history to the girl working at the front to prove that they spoke and she reserved for 4 at 7 pm. Then before even trying to resolve our issue
column6: she told us to move so she can help the people that came after us. She was not accommodating at all even though it was an issue on their end. Ended up leaving the place and had to frantically search for other restaurants on a Friday night at the most busiest time. Thanks for ruining my friend's birthday."

author: Kyle Englishman

author: Lauren Chun
text: 'Very disappointed. 1. Got served 15 minutes after the table got after us
column5: 2. Took forever to receive our drinks
column6: 3. One of the group received incorrect order. All with absolutely no apologies. Definitely will not be coming back to this establishment. There are too many amazing restaurants in Hoboken to be coming back to such a place. It feels like a waste of time to be even writing this review.'

author: Lucia Arias
text: "We walk by very often and always saw good dishes for dinner
column5: so decided to try it out
column6: but decided to go for brunch....DON'T DO BRUNCH HERE. It took us over 2 hours to eat
column7: the wait couldn't have been longer
column8: they wouldn't serve us bread (???!!!) So we had to eat a cheese a board without bread or crackers. The food was extremely salty and the portions were small. Honestly couldn't get out fast enough. Not worth it

text: "Worst experience !! I went for brunch and waited more than an hour for 2 plates! Nobody would come to ask if we needed anything !!the worst customer service. I'm never coming here again !!"

author: Divya N
text: 'This was a really cute restaurant me and my friends stumbled upon! Everything from the drinks to the entrees to the desserts was spot on and the ambiance was perfect!'

author: Kristina Grosso
text: 'Met a good friend for dinner here that i have not seen in awhile. We were informed of the 90 minute table time limit at the beginning which is fair because we agreed. Hostess was very nice. My issue is about 10 minutes before the 90 minutes was up
column5: we asked to order dessert and dessert cocktails.  The waiter said sure and then dissapeared.  A few minutes later
column6: a manager appeared and just put the check on our table with no explanation. We said
column7: oh we would like to order dessert and he said sorry but the 90 minutes is up.\nI understand that these restaurants are trying to make money and turn tables quickly and its a difficult time for them but this really turned me off to be honest. We had just ordered drinks
column9: and meal enteees and spent a good amount of money. We were enjoying our dinner at a reasonable pace and asked to order more
column10: not to just sit with the check and hold up a table.  What turned me off even more was they then took their sweet time to take our credit cards to pay and we probabaly could have enjoyed dessert during that period of time. We then went to buy our own liquor to make our own dessert cocktails at home and walked by 10 minutes later and the table was still empty.\nI like to enjoy the experience of dining out when spending that amount of money on a meal and the feeling of being rushed out was not worth it to me and i probabaly will not go back because of it.'

author: Sophia T
text: 'I highly recommend the bolognese'

text: 'Service was -5 stars. Food was just alright and very expensive. We went out for a friend‚Äôs birthday so it was supposed to be very special but the server ruined this experience for us. text: 'Had a fabulous meal last night. The outdoor seating was comfortable

author: Katherine Kaplan
text: 'Had a wonderful outdoor dinner here. The spaces between tables and the adorable patio made the whole meal feel both safe and enjoyable. The staff was very pleasant
column5: they wore masks and gloves. The calamari appetizer was amazing
column6: the breading was very light
column7: the  calamari were fresh not frozen and the sweet&sour broth under the calamari was lovely. The oversized meatballs appetizer was great. The mussels with spaghetti main course was good but the mussels were very small. For dessert we asked the server for a suggestion
column8: so happy he recommended to get the tiramisu
column9: it was homemade and one of the best I have ever tried.'

author: hugo mancera
text: 'Beautiful place and great atmosphere at this small Italian restaurant. Amazing food and good drinks
column5: but where it really fell short was the customer service and the cold food.\n\nThe customer service could have been way better... I really believe it may have been our server
column6: as it seemed everyone else was well attended to. We requested water and it was never brought. However
column7: the couple behind me was offered water for their dog multiple times. He stayed at their table and attended to them and their dog continously. We had to ask for bread during our dinner course
column8: yet it was served to everyone else upon being seated.\n\nThe food was amazing
column9: just very unfortunate that it was served cold to us 45 minutes after sitting down. Our meatball appetizer and pasta with bolognese both seemed to have sat in the kitchen for an extended period of time prior to being served to us.\n\nI will go back again in hopes of better service.'

author: Mary McPartland
text: 'Brought our college son here for his 20th birthday. We had hoped to eat a bit down memory lane at one of the older Hoboken sauce joints
column5: but one was closed for 3 month reno
column6: the other fully booked. Took a chance here at 9:45pm. Place was half-full
column7: as it was late on a cold March Friday night. Lent ... not any fish options except salad and soup
column8: which was weird in an Italian place. We had to pick meat dishes and pretended it was after midnight and no longer Friday in Lent. Meatballs were good
column10: wine was delish. The only thing we really were bummed about was the cold
column12: no flourishes mini ice cream sandwich plunked down on the table ... after we told the waitress it was a birthday celebration and made a special request for a little something extra. No one conveyed this to the kitchen. Underwhelming.'

author: Alex Wegweiser
text: 'Great atmosphere with good wine selection. Their drink menu is an iPad which goes into details their wine offerings. Food is tasty but portions are a little small compared to the usual Italian restaurant.'

author: Alejandro Fernandez
text: 'One of the best Italian restaurants in Hoboken'

author: Francesco Corbatto
text: 'Very good food and service'

author: Mark A Marashlian
text: 'Outstanding everything.'

author: Karen Garrity
text: 'Love this restaurant! Fabulous food and incredible wine selection! A must go!'

author: D. Campisano
text: 'Great food
column5: service & atmosphere.'

author: G Mulholland
text: 'Outstanding food and service'

author: Jeffrey Fischer
text: 'Cute vibe
column5: tacky Christmas decorations but it worked. The cocktails were pretty good
column6: and the apps came out rather fast but the entree took forever to come out. Seems like it was a problem with the kitchen and their way of doing things. The bartender kept saying that the chef insists on doing it "bar style". Other than that
column7: the bartender was friendly and honestly I\'d probably go back again.'

author: Sydney Slavik
text: 'Excellent food. Friendly staff. Great wine.'

author: Tom Koty
text: 'Great food and service. Love the monthly/seasonal food and drink menu.'

author: Chris Frie
text: 'Great on Tuesday night with good friends. Cheers!'

author: Abee Davis
text: 'Love this restaurant!EXCELLENT food & service !'

author: Atif Qadir
text: 'Uptown Hoboken classic'

author: Matt Kuruvilla
text: 'Looked good enough for my wife and I to enjoy a night out. However
column5: the other reviews about it being more expensive than it was worth felt really true.\n\nWe didn\'t enjoy the crudite
column6:
pasta was pretty good.
Atmosphere feels like it's catering to a large crowd - sports bar style TVs while boasting fine italian food.

We asked to cork the wine to take home; the server was accomodating. Then the busboy whisked in and took the wine away while we went to the restroom. Honest mistake but super frustrating. His reply when when we asked about it - "Oh
column7: I threw it out. I can get you a cork though." My dear consolation prize...\n\nThe owner was sitting at the bar watching the exvhange and didn\'t say a word
column8: which was weird.\n\nOverall not a place for a romantic evening
column9: maybe go with a buddy to get some quick food.'

author: Tad Bowler
text: 'Delicious N Italian restaurant!'

author: Mike Mariniello
text: 'Great meal and better desert'

author: Steven Mayotte
text: "Our favorite place for pasta in Hoboken.  Haven't had any pasta dish that wasn't great.  They have nice wines and outdoor seating.  Highly recommend"

author: Kristen Corbisiero
text: 'Sorrellina‚Äôs has some of the best pasta dishes I‚Äôve ever had in the NYC area. We‚Äôve visited the restaurant a few times and have had consistent service and excellent meals. The pasta dishes are the shining stars of the menus. With so many dining options possible in Hoboken I‚Äôm okay with saying I‚Äôd go to Sorrellina‚Äôs multiple times before exploring other options because it‚Äôs just that good. We will be back!'

author: Christopher Hill
text: 'Very very salty food.'

author: Ralph Pawlik
text: 'Food was absolutely amazing
column5: I have been to make italian restaurants but soerellina blows out most of them out of water. Strongly recommend
column6: staff is too nice as well.'

author: Kimmy k
text: 'Over priced and the food was way out there with nothing simple on the menu for the non adventurous. I ordered one thing and was served another completely different dish. While it was good and i ate it
column5: it was still annoying.'

author: Kathleen O'Hara
text: 'Decent food. Fantastic wine selection. Awful service. Plenty of better options for Italian in Hoboken.'

author: Megan Ung
text: 'Overall the food was good and the atmosphere was nice. The food was a bit on the salty side for me but it was still yummy.'

author: Doug S
text: "Really nice place with great food and drinks. I went there recently and there was a live band. I tried my first aperol spritz there and it was very refreshing and well made. My fiance goes all the time and loves it as well. It's a but further uptown
column5: so it's much more low key than a lot  of other restaurants in Hoboken. Definitely reccomend going there for food and/or drinks."

author: Alan Klayman
text: 'Good Italian tastes.  Small portions.  Small pours.  Chef is NOT very accommodating.  Place thinks it is more than it is.'

author: Alex M
text: 'I never leave bad reviews. I have worked in the restaurant industry so i dont really judge. But I hava never been so disappointed by the food
column5: drinks
column6: and service. Food was flavorless and generic
column7: service was inattentive. My wife and I left the meal halfway thru without finishing to go eat at another Italian joint.'

author: Katie Picinich
text: "Great homemade pasta and amazing I've cream cookie sandwiches."

author: David Gil
text: 'Great food and wine selection as you would expect from a wine bar. The service was excellent and had little to no wait when I try this place. Must check out restaurant if you are in the area'

author: Jonathan Zamora
text: 'Food was terrible never coming back'

author: Mary
text: 'I‚Äôve been here for dinner twice. The food
column5: wine and atmosphere were great!'

author: J A
text: 'Great atmosphere
column5: good wine selection
column6: ok service
column7: but unfortunately terrible food. Would suggest you stop by for a drink before heading elsewhere for dinner.'

author: Myles Helfand
text: "Hoboken's most upscale Italian restaurant
column5: but it's got a down-to-earth feel that makes it feel more comfy than hoity. It's hard to be disappointed by a dish here
column6: unless you put a priority on getting large plates of food; entrees should be enough to fill you up (esp if you split an appetizer) but probably not enough to take home for leftovers."

author: Allie Gazda
text: 'Good wine selection
column5: Italian wines. Had a few drinks before dinner it was a good way to start the night.'

author: Neeta Chitre-King
text: 'Love this place! For Everything!'

author: Esther Pressler
text: 'Went once
column5: we didn‚Äôt like the food or the service.  The waiter was clearly stoned.  He had a distinct pot-head vibe
column6: and not in a nice mellow way.  It was more of an ‚ÄúI‚Äôm too high to care if you give me a bad tip and complain to the manager‚Äù way.  I hear they have good early weeknight specials
column7: so I‚Äôm bumping this up to two stars.'

author: Charles Creamer
text: "We attended a pre-fixe birthday dinner
column5: and a few of our friends have some fairly severe dietary restrictions. Not only was the food excellent
column6: but Sorellina's staff was meticulous in ensuring our experience was top-notch. One star subtracted just because I'm cheap and it can be pricey : D"

author: Kristina K
text: 'Had a great time here. We had a knowledgeable waitress that was fun yet professional. We ordered the NY strip and squid ink pasta and both our plates were licked clean. Beyond that
column5: we came in before closing (little to our knowledge) yet they still treated us without a rush. Truly care about their customers. Would come back.'

author: Marco Noriega
text: 'The food is was cool and taste bad'

author: Marissa Liberacki
text: 'I love this place. Pasta was amazing. They served us little apps compliments of the house. Our server was great at suggesting wine. Definitely will be back.'

author: Mike Falvo
text: 'High price
column5: slow service
column6: average quality food.'

author: Kristina Nash
text: 'Impossibly slow brunch. More wandering employees than there were tables. Then received a cold
column5: rubbery
column6: waterlogged fritatta suggesting it may have been better the day before
column7: which is when I suspect it was actually made.'

author: Chrissy Lombardi
text: 'Creative use of seasonal items. Everything is always fresh and the cocktails are AMAZING! Great wine selection as well!'

author: Erin Carrather
text: 'Good wine selection.'

author: William L Jones Jr
text: 'Amazing food..'

author: Thomas Preziose
text: 'Food is always very good. My go to is the branzino.'

author: Paul Lichstein
text: 'innovative.  great use of lemon.  roasted vegetables were superb.  doll ravioli was out of this world'

author: Ron Lombardi
text: "Awesome place
column5: great food and wine. Definitely worth checking  out. A 1930's bar with Italian beers on tap."

author: David Torres
text: "It's a nice place with good servers but the food was disappointing. I had gnoquis that were salty with a bland sauce to my taste."

author: Matthew Connors
text: 'I stumbled upon this restaurant late on a Saturday and was pleasantly surprised. The food was above my expectations and the service was excellent.'

author: Brett Coleman
text: 'So good.  Soooooooooo good!  The services
column5: the food
column6: the wine and beer - all excellent.  Highly recommended.'

author: Chris Lau
text: 'Good Italian spot in Hoboken. Fresh sour dough is awesome'

author: Brent Kottner
text: "Wonderful service. Great atmosphere. Food was incredible. It was our first time and we'll absolutely be going back."

author: Daniel Peykar
text: 'made valentines day reservations and and they saved the day!'

author: Sara Freixa
text: 'Best pasta I have tried in a really long time. Finding good pasta in the US is quite a gem. One that is not swimming in sauce or overly tomatoed. This is your place. The cacio e pepe pasta was to die for. The atmosphere was very romantic too. Love it!'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Since my boyfriend is new to Hoboken
column5: we decided to take a stroll around the neighborhood. We passed by Sorellina
column6: which looked like a cute date spot. Since we had some time to kill
column7: we decided to grab a drink.\n\nI had the Forza Negroni (Bulleit Bourbon
column9: Campari) and he had the Classico Negroni (Dorothy Parker Gin
column11: Campari). Both tasted pretty similar and had a little too much Campari for my taste. You're probably better off sticking to a glass of vino from their wine list
column12: which is pretty extensive and reasonably priced.\n\nSome of the appetizers stood out to us so we also ordered a bite to eat. We had the Grilled Cherrystone Clam Spiedini {with housemade chorizo
column13: caracara orange marmalade & sourdough croutons} and Nonna's Meatballs (pomodoro braised veal & ricotta). Neither of these appetizers were good. They certainly looked appetizing but that was about it. The clams were ridiculously chewy. I even tried cutting them up into super tiny pieces but even then
column14: it was extremely difficult to eat. The meatballs had an okay flavor but the texture was just not the way meatballs should be. I don't know what it was - maybe they ground up their meat too much but the consistency was that of a hot dog. My boyfriend compared it to a Vienna sausage.\n\nI was really hoping to like this place but if the appetizers we ordered weren't very good
column15: I'm not sure if I would want to be back to try the mains. Guess we'll just have to find another go-to Italian spot in the neighborhood."

author: Nick Gaglio
text: 'Parents should boycott Sorellina until they drop the hostility towards children. ‚Ä¶'

author: Daniel L
text: 'Excellent food
column5: a little understaffed in terms of servers
column6: but very good experience'

author: Angela Cucinello
text: 'Arrived last night for dinner & seated at 9:30 restaurant was not full
column5: wait time for dinner was 1 hour and obviously since they were not busy it was pretty much inexcusable.   The wait staff could not be found and did not check on the ‚Ä¶'

author: A L
text: 'Foods are great
column5: homemade chocolate cake is different and good.\n5 stars to the staff
column6: generous smiles
column7: good services.\nWent on Friday night so serving was a bit slow. ‚Ä¶'

author: Serg C
text: 'Excellent wine selection and delicious cheese options. Looking forward to trying the rest of their menu!!'

author: Maggie Kaderbek
text: 'Amazing brunch!!'
